info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 24 at 1:12PM PDT until July 26 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TUESDAY TO 8 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures 90 to 100 expected. * WHERE...San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire and San Diego County Valleys. Areas below 5,000 feet in the San Bernardino, Riverside and San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...From 10 AM Tuesday to 8 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur. Take frequent breaks if outdoors for long periods of time.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, take frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
